discourse_list.title: Maker can have a monopoly power over stablecoins lending!

content.content: Maker has a huge network effect as the only decentralized stablecoin with real and organic liquidity. with (1st) Peg Stabilization Modules + (2nd) my suggestion to improve PSM (which I will explain below): I think we will fix many of the problems that are facing Dai today and also give Maker a monopoly power in the service of lending all types of stablecoins in Defi space. with these 2 improvements we will: 1- have a very powerful tool to prevent DAI from losing the peg higher than 1$ 2- we will be able to scale DAI supply significantly 3- we will be able to have some SF implemented on vaults even when there is a big demand on DAI 4- will significantly lower the risks of using usdc and other centralized stablecoins as collaterals 5- will generate new source of income to Maker holders and give Maker a monopoly power over lending different types of stablecoins if you didn’t already then please read     Peg Stabilization Modules: A Pre-MIP Discussion Proposal Ideas       Introduction The Maker community has been intensively discussing how to address the issues surrounding the DAI peg over the last three months. The recent pressure caused by COMP farmers using Dai as their asset of choice has accelerated the need to address this issue more formally.  As of today, the community is moving forward with the response of increasing the USDC debt ceiling, which is important because it means that Maker Governance is showing a willingness to defend the peg, ultimately hel…      I think PSM is a good fix for some of Dai problems but I think that implementing PSM alone has 2 major problems tens or hundreds of millions of centralized stablecoins (for example usdc) locked in PSM represent 1- a risk to Maker 2- a missed opportunity what are the risks? the most important risks that I can think of: 1- usdc locked in PSM can be blacklisted (for whatever reason) 2- usdc can depeg and lose all or part of its value what is the missed opportunity? having tens or hundreds of millions of usdc locked in PSM means that the DAI minted using these assets  is not generating income to Maker protocol except small spread fees My suggestion to improve PSM I think we should simply lend most of the locked usdc and we should set the lending value for each centralized stable coin to 1$… this means if usdc depeged and lost some or all of its value then usdc holders will take the loss not Maker. for example If I borrowed 10k usdc from PSM and USDC depeged down to zero $ (for whatever reason) then I will still have to pay back 10k dollars back to PSM to free my collateral using another type of assets (may be DAI?) this suggestion will remove most of the risks like blacklisting and depeging of usdc also will generate new stream of income of Maker holders
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes improvements to the Peg Stabilization Modules (PSM) of Maker, which would fix some of the problems facing Dai and give Maker a monopoly power in the service of lending all types of stablecoins in the DeFi space. The author suggests lending most of the locked USDC and setting the lending value for each centralized stable coin to $1 to remove most of the risks like blacklisting and depegging of USDC and generate a new stream of income for Maker holders. A third party gives constructive criticism and extends to the proposal.

content.content: This idea seems pretty good at first glance.  I have two sets of questions:   Since the major risk appears to be blacklisting of the USDC that MakerDao holds wouldn’t this mean that borrowers potentially fear the same risk and would refuse to borrow USDC from the PSM without significantly better rates compared to the rest of the market to offset that risk? Extend your thinking out and make the assumption that the USDC was eventually blacklisted.  What are the next steps in that case?   What happens in the event that the PSM is not generating enough USDC loans and yet it is still accumulating a lot of USDC giving MakerDao that exposure you mentioned?   I am for ideas that balance the Peg but also keep MakerDao safe from exposure to USDC falling to $0.00 overnight or being blacklisted.

content.content: Thanks @mmoossttaaffaa. I think you start a very much needed discussion: how do we get rid of the risk on the USDC? Rather than implementing implementing new stuff, which is difficult:     smaugho:  IMO this a very valid (and powerful) proposal. Only issue I see is the technical challenge of implementing new Vaults to lend USDC for instance.   Why don’t we just:  Once we have embarked, 1m USDC (from the PSM) take 1m DAI from the SB (surplus buffer), when available. put 1m DAI + 1m USDC (2m USD of value) on LP on Uniswap (or Curve or whatever).  This way we obtain the following results:  We increase DAI liquidity in markets. We get fees on the LP pair DAI/USDC  Most importantly, we get rid of USDC and we instead get in our hands LP tokens. This means that, central authorities can only blacklist the USDC in the Uniswap contract (which affects everybody) not MakerDAO’s LP tokens!  Note 1: this simple solution does not protect us from USDC going to 0. But it protect us from central authorities attacking MakerDAO by blacklisting its USDC. Which I think is, by far, the greater of the two risks. Note 2: there is a bottleneck here, step (2). We are limited by the amount of money available in the SB. Other alternatives can be considered though, but for the moment I leave it there.
